item.title: Electronic Arts to be acquired by investor consortium trio for $55 billion
item.content:encoded:
The largest all-cash sponsor take-private investment in history.

Electronic Arts has entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by an investor consortium comprised of PIF, Silver Lake, and Affinity Partners in an all-cash transaction that values the company at an enterprise value of approximately $55 billion, it announced. The consortium will acquire 100 percent of Electronic Arts, with PIF rolling over its existing 9.9 percent stake in the company.

According to the press release, all three parties bring “deep sector experience, committed capital, and global portfolios with networks across gaming, entertainment, and sports that offer unique possibilities for [Electronic Arts] to blend physical and digital experiences, enhance fan engagement, and create new growth opportunities.” The transaction also represents the largest all-cash sponsor take-private investment in history.

Find comments from each party below.

Andrew Wilson, Electronic Arts Chairman and CEO

“Our creative and passionate teams at EA have delivered extraordinary experiences for hundreds of millions of fans, built some of the world’s most iconic IP, and created significant value for our business. This moment is a powerful recognition of their remarkable work. Looking ahead, we will continue to push the boundaries of entertainment, sports, and technology, unlocking new opportunities. Together with our partners, we will create transformative experiences to inspire generations to come. I am more energized than ever about the future we are building.”

Luis A. Ubinas, Electronic Arts Board of Directors Lead Independent Director

“The Board carefully evaluated this opportunity and concluded it delivers compelling value for stockholders and is in the best interests of all stakeholders. We are pleased that this transaction delivers immediate and certain cash value to our stockholders while strengthening EA’s ability to continue building the communities and experiences that define the future of entertainment.”

Turqi Alnowaiser, PIF Deputy Governor and Head of International Investments

“PIF is uniquely positioned in the global gaming and esports sectors, building and supporting ecosystems that connect fans, developers, and IP creators. PIF has demonstrated a strong commitment to these sectors, and this partnership will help further drive EA’s long-term growth, while fueling innovation within the industry on a global scale.”

Egon Durban, Silver Lake Co-CEO and Managing Partner

“This investment embodies Silver Lake’s mission to partner with exceptional management teams at the highest quality companies. EA is a special company: a global leader in interactive entertainment, anchored by its premier sports franchise, with accelerating revenue growth and strong and scaling free cash flow. We are honored to invest and partner with Andrew—an extraordinary CEO who has doubled revenue, nearly tripled EBITDA, and driven a fivefold increase in market cap during his tenure. The future for EA is bright, we are going to invest heavily to grow the business and we are excited to support Andrew and the EA team as the company accelerates innovation, expands its reach worldwide, and continues to deliver incredible experiences to players and fans across generations.”

Jared Kushner, Affinity Partners CEO

“Electronic Arts ​is ​an ​extraordinary ​company with a ​world-class ​management ​team and a bold vision ​for ​the ​future. ​I’ve admired their ​ability to create iconic, lasting experiences, ​and ​as ​someone ​who ​grew up playing their ​games—and now enjoys them with his ​kids—I couldn’t be ​more ​excited about ​what’s ​ahead.”

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero version 2.3 update ‘Memories of Dreams Bygone’ launches October 15
item.content:encoded:
The version 2.3 update for Zenless Zone Zero, dubbed “Memories of Dreams Bygone,” will launch on October 15, developer miHoYo announced.

Here is an overview of the update, via miHoYo:

In this latest update, players will team up with Spook Shack and set foot in the newly unlocked Timesworn Hills, where ghost stories echo through abandoned ruins in the Hollow. Lucia, Yidhari, and Komano Manato join the battlefield as new Agents, accompanied by fresh gameplay, new outfits for Vivian and Manato, and engaging events.

The newly revealed Timesworn Hills region, known for its abundant Lumite ore deposits, conceals abandoned research facilities and testing ground ruins where chilling legends thrive. Tales of miners who vanished within the Miasma, the tolling of a phantom bell, creatures that gaze into people’s hearts, and hypnotists capable of ensnaring victims in endless dreams haunt the land. This new adventure begins with the case of missing miners and Porcelumex employees, drawing Proxies into the Hollow to uncover unsettling truths.

The new members from Spook Shack bring not only fascination with haunted tales but also formidable strength to the battlefield. Lucia, an S-Rank Ether Support Agent and devoted Ethereal fan, wields dreamlike powers to recreate Ethereals in combat. By accumulating Dream Points, she can enter a Dream state and unleash Ether Veil: Wellspring, boosting all allies’ max HP while enhancing team damage through increased Sheer Force and triggering Aftershocks. Yidhari, an S-Rank Ice Rupture Agent, embodies both risk and resilience. She gains Sheer Force based on her max HP, and her ice attacks always inflict Sheer DMG, piercing through enemy defenses. Her damage increases as her HP percentage drops, rewarding a delicate balance of HP loss and recovery. Meanwhile, Komano Manato, now joining the battlefield as an A-Rank Fire Rupture Agent, unleashes Sheer DMG with strikes that scale from his max HP. In addition, S-level agents Vivian (Ether – Anomaly) and Ju Fufu (Fire – Stun) will return in this version’s banners.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Zenless Zone Zero continuously gears up to deliver eventful content and optimized combat experiences. In Version 2.3, Soldier 0 – Anby will be enhanced through refined combat mechanics and boosted performance to unleash her latent combat potential. New gameplay “Threshold Simulation” offers both tactical and combat challenges as Proxies deploy multiple squads to withstand interconnected battle scenarios. The event “When Dreams Remain Unfinished” introduces turn-based combat, where players command various categories of monsters with unique traits and tactical positioning. Completing the event also grants Agent Manato as a free reward. Additionally, the beloved “SNAP! Shining Strike” photography event returns with an upgrade, offering more freedom with camera controls, diverse filters and frames, allowing players to capture stunning scenes.

As New Eridu’s story continues to unfold, Zenless Zone Zero offers a heartfelt glimpse of what lies ahead. Future agents — including Banyue, Dialyn, Zhao, and Ye Shunguang — are set to join the Proxies’ journey in the near future. As a token of gratitude for embarking on the adventures still to come, Proxies can claim an extra 600 Polychromes in addition to the regular rewards of 10 Encrypted Master Tapes and 10 Boopons during Version 2.3.

Zenless Zone Zero is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play.

item.title: Silent Hill f shipments and digital sales top one million
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Milestone achieved one day after release.

Total shipments and digital sales for Silent Hill f have surpassed one million units worldwide as of September 26, Konami announced.

Silent Hill f launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Microsoft Store on September 25, meaning the milestone was achieved one day after release.

Here is an overview of the game, via Konami:

About

In 1960s Japan, Shimizu Hinako’s secluded town of Ebisugaoka is consumed by a sudden fog, transforming her home into a haunting nightmare.

As the town falls silent and the fog thickens, Hinako must navigate the twisted paths of Ebisugaoka, solving complex puzzles and confronting grotesque monsters to survive.

Immerse yourself into Hinako’s world imagined by renowned author Ryukishi07, with entrancing music, including pieces by Akira Yamaoka, and beautiful visuals in a gripping tale of doubt, regret, and inescapable choices. Will Hinako embrace the beauty hidden within terror, or succumb to the madness that lies ahead?

Discover a new chapter in the Silent Hill series, blending psychological horror with a haunting Japanese setting.
